sources.full: Esquizofrenia Coletiva com Amigos: Art Domain

subclassFeature.name: Art Domain
entries: Art Domain clerics are those who, in their religious temples, churches and abbeys, chant praises and songs that enchant and excite all the faithful, but their main aim is to show the beauty of art when it is directed towards their god. A bard who, faced with the difficulties of life, needed shelter in a convent and there learned the beauties of religious life and there converted to Art Domain, a minstrel who dedicated his poetry and texts to magnify the deeds of his god and his church. In all these cases, art was the means they found to live out their faith, and this is what a religious artist strives for.

These clerics are not tied to specific deities, as their songs and praises can be dedicated to any deity or belief, as long as their art is required. Cultists who worship Vecna may want songs and poems in their rites that intone the beauty of necromancy, and devotees of Pelor may request the presence of these clerics to worship the sun at a summer solstice festival.

subclassFeature.name: Artistic versatility
entries: By choosing this domain at level 1, you gain proficiency in 2 skills and a musical instrument of your choice. You can use musical instruments as a conjuring focus for your cleric spells.
You also learn the Vicious Mockery trick, which counts as a cleric spell for you, but does not count towards the number of tricks you know.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Divine Inspiration
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to chant soothing praises to your allies and weave divine inspiration. With your action on your turn, you choose a number of creatures within 9 meters of you equal to your Wisdom modifier. For 1 minute, whenever the chosen creatures roll an attack roll, they can add your Wisdom modifier to the roll.

subclassFeature.name: Sermon is also art
entries: Once you reach level 6, your wit is as good as a diplomat's. The art makes you understand the people and the church, so you can speak what they want to hear. Whenever you roll a Persuasion or Deception test, you can add your Wisdom modifier to the test. In addition, when you spend at least 1 minute showing your art in public, such as in a temple, hall, tavern or square, you can roll a Perfomance test to determine the quality of the presentation, on a success, determined by the Master, you gain a point of inspiration.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Divine comfort
entries: Also from 6th level, you can use your Channel Divinity as an action to choose a number of creatures within 9 meters of you equal to your Wisdom modifier and end frightening or bewitching effects that are affecting them (you choose for each creature).

subclassFeature.name: Powerful conjuration
entries: From 8th level, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage dealt by any cleric trick, this damage is psychic.

subclassFeature.name: Every artist has a group
entries: At level 17, your bond with your friends and traveling companions has become very strong and most of the songs and writings you create are about the adventures you've been on together. As a bonus action, you can create a bond between you and your companions by choosing a number of them within 18 meters of you equal to your proficiency bonus. For 1 minute, you and your bonded companions can add your Wisdom modifier to all your skill and endurance tests and attack rolls. When a bonded companion takes damage or fails a resistance test from an effect originating from a creature you see within 27 meters of you, you can use your reaction to force this creature to make a Wisdom resistance test against your magic DC, suffering 3d8 psychic damage if you fail, or half if you pass. After using this ability, you can't use it again until you've completed a long rest.
